thread.title: Tottenham boss Mauricio Pochettino admits £9,500 'tunnel tickets' at Spurs' new ground could be "dangerous"
thread.title_full: Tottenham boss Mauricio Pochettino admits £9,500 'tunnel tickets' at Spurs' new ground could be "dangerous"

author: Darren Lewis
title: Tottenham boss Mauricio Pochettino admits £9,500 'tunnel tickets' at Spurs' new ground could be "dangerous"
text:
Sport Tottenham boss Mauricio Pochettino admits £9,500 'tunnel tickets' at Spurs' new ground could be "dangerous" The north Londoners gave an insight into the glittering, £750million arena with an impressive virtual reality tour on Thursday Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Tottenham Hotspur unveil their new stadium Share this video Get football   
Mauricio Pochettino admits it could be “dangerous” to allow fans to get a unique view into the players’ tunnel at Tottenham's new stadium. 
The north Londoners gave an insight into the glittering, £750million arena - set to open in August 2018 - with an impressive virtual reality tour on Thursday. 
The club are selling 104 corporate seats directly behind the dugout with access to a glass-walled restaurant adjacent to where the players’ line up to walk out. 
Asked about the potential experience, however, Pochettino smiled: “Dangerous, dangerous. Because there have been a lot of things in the tunnel. It is for that (reason) it will be very expensive (seat)”. Spurs' new ground (Photo: Tottenham Hotspur) The EMB Lounge (Photo: Tottenham Hotspur) The Sky Lounge at the new ground (Photo: Tottenham Hotspur) 
The 'tunnel tickets' will cost £9,500 each but must be bought in pairs. 
There is also a one-off, compulsory membership fee of £30,000 for the two seats. 
They are second in price to the 'H club', which Spurs say will have Michelin-star level dining with tickets costing £15,000 a seat, excluding the membership fee. East Lower concourse (Photo: Tottenham Hotspur) The controversial Tunnel Club (Photo: Tottenham Hotspur) The expensive H Club (Photo: Tottenham Hotspur) 
Some 7,000 seats of the 61,000 capacity will be corporate as Tottenham look to part fund the stadium. 
Construction on the new ground began in July and included a corner of White Hart Lane being demolished. The EMB Sky Lounge (Photo: Tottenham Hotspur) Spurs say food in the H Club will be Michelin-star quality (Photo: Tottenham Hotspur) East Premium Dining (Photo: Tottenham Hotspur) 
The work has also taken Spurs to Wembley to play their European fixtures, which included three games in the Champions League group stage before they were knocked out. 
Tottenham also want to host NFL games at their lavish new home as well as Premier League and continental football.
